basic_info.description: I'm a Ph.D. student working at the Computatiaonl Interaction Lab, Saarland University. My current research interest is mainly focused in analyzing and predicting user's fixations when interacting with interface. Before moving to the Germany, I also have few research experience in huamn reliability analysis and data visualization.

projects.title: Human Reliability Analyses based on Cognitive Motivation Model
description: Conducting a simulation to model the impact of motivation intensity on human performance with artificial neural network.
Leading a team of four students in designing and conducting simulated experiment on aircraft approaching process.
Examining statistical analyses of different influencing factors on human performance; techniques used includes ANOVA, regression analysis, and smoothing with curve fitting.

projects.title: Comparative Study of User Behaviors between Immersive and Desktop Environment
description: Designing and conducting the experiment on the US Covid-19 map visual interface on both desktop and AR environment.
Implementing the machine-learning based classification methods such as kNN, CNN and ROCKET, on the user data to predict the task type.
Providing the interpretation results on the explorative task participants doing with the trained model.

education.location: St. Louis, United States of America
education.title: Master Student, Data Analytics & Statistics
